response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age (19 years old)", "medium", "Young age is associated with increased risk of recidivism, though being an adult reduces some risk found in minors."),
    ("Gender (Male)", "high", "Males statistically have a higher likelihood of rearrest compared to females."),
    ("Race (White)", "medium", "While race alone is not deterministic, in some analyses, White individuals are considered neutral, leaning towards medium risk when combined with other factors."),
    ("Criminal History (1 arrest and conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest and conviction indicate some criminal involvement, increasing recidivism risk moderately."),
    ("Physical Attributes (5 ft 11 in, 160 lbs)", "low", "Physical characteristics such as height and weight do not typically influence recidivism risk."),
    ("Marital Status (Never married, living alone)", "medium", "Lack of a stable support system, as suggested by being never married and living alone, moderately increases risk."),
    ("Education (High school diploma, not in college)", "medium", "Having a high school diploma provides some stability, yet not pursuing further education can limit future opportunities, moderately affecting risk."),
    ("Employment (Held 1 job during the year)", "medium", "Limited job stability is a moderate risk factor for recidivism."),
    ("Substance Use (Used marijuana and cocaine in past four years)", "high", "Recent drug use, especially including cocaine, is strongly associated with recidivism risk."),
    ("Mental Health (Not felt depressed in the past month)", "low", "Lack of recent depression is a protective factor against recidivism."),
    ("Family Background (Lived with both biological parents in childhood in an urban area)", "low", "A stable family environment is generally protective, reducing risk."),
    ("Religious Beliefs (Considers God has nothing to do with personal events)", "medium", "Low religiosity can be associated with less social support and community engagement, moderately increasing risk.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with increased risk of recidivism, though being an adult reduces some risk found in minors.
Males statistically have a higher likelihood of rearrest compared to females.
While race alone is not deterministic, in some analyses, White individuals are considered neutral, leaning towards medium risk when combined with other factors.
A prior arrest and conviction indicate some criminal involvement, increasing recidivism risk moderately.
Physical characteristics such as height and weight do not typically influence recidivism risk.
Lack of a stable support system, as suggested by being never married and living alone, moderately increases risk.
Education (High school diploma, not in college)
Having a high school diploma provides some stability, yet not pursuing further education can limit future opportunities, moderately affecting risk.
Limited job stability is a moderate risk factor for recidivism.
Substance Use (Used marijuana and cocaine in past four years)
Recent drug use, especially including cocaine, is strongly associated with recidivism risk.
Mental Health (Not felt depressed in the past month)
Lack of recent depression is a protective factor against recidivism.
Family Background (Lived with both biological parents in childhood in an urban area)
A stable family environment is generally protective, reducing risk.
Religious Beliefs (Considers God has nothing to do with personal events)
Low religiosity can be associated with less social support and community engagement, moderately increasing risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 160 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
